Package fast3d.control

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Control
    offers the possibility to react on user input
    a control implements all AWT-event-listeners which can be (un)bound using activate() or deactivate()
    a panel3d should call on preRender() the performInput() method
    subclasses have to implement performInput() to do what they intend to change on the panel3d
    subclasses should call activate(boolean, boolean, boolean, boolean, boolean) in onActivate() to let the control register the desired listeners - same procedure in onDeactivate()
    subclasses can easily override the AWT-event-methods to save the user action until performInput is called
    it is highly recommended do only do changes on the panel3d in performInput()
    the backing Panel3d can be accessed by the protected field p3d
    MultiControl
    a very easy to use control: add all the controls you want to apply to a Panel3d to the filed subControls and than add this control to the Panel3d
    at onActivate() all subControls are activated (equivalent at onDeactivate())
    at performInput() all controls are asked to perform their input
    the call to the subControls is in the order, specified by the list
    by call activate() you activate all subControls (similar to deactivate())
    the built-in simple controls do not work together because they override the entire camera-positioning every frame -- controls used by MulitControl should be designed to work together
    SimpleControl
    provides some protected fields to easily access the most useful properties of a SimplePanel3d
    sp3d - the cast of p3d to SimplePanel3d framerate - short for sp3d.frameRate() universe - short for sp3d.getUni() cam - short for sp3d.getCam()
    can be used just like a normal control
